Package tools.io

Class ImageSheetLoader

  • java.lang.Object
    • tools.io.ImageSheetLoader
  • public final class ImageSheetLoader
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides a convinient way of storing image sheets for a multi-threaded environment.

    An image sheet consists of a 2D BufferedImage array, where each element arr[x][y] denotes the image at the coorcinates (x, y).

    • Method Detail

      • loadImage

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage[][] loadImage​(FileTree fileTree,
                                                         java.lang.String path)
                                                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                         java.io.IOException
        Loads an image from the given source and convert it into an image sheet.
        Parameters:
        fileTree - The file tree to use.
        path - The path of the file inside the file tree.
        Returns:
        A 2D BufferedImage array, with the images loaded such that bi[x][y] represents the image part at (x, y) from the selected part (starting at (0, 0)).
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If some I/O error occured.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the given bounding values do not match with the bounds of the image sheet.
        See Also:
        loadImage(FileTree, String, String)

      • loadImage

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage[][] loadImage​(FileTree fileTree,
                                                         java.lang.String path,
                                                         int width,
                                                         int height)
                                                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                         java.io.IOException
        Loads an image from the given source and convert it into an image sheet.
        Each image in this sheet has size (width, height).
        Parameters:
        fileTree - The file tree to use.
        path - The path of the file inside the file tree.
        width - The width of each sub-image.
        height - The height of each sub-image.
        Returns:
        A 2D BufferedImage array, with the images loaded such that bi[x][y] represents the image part at (x, y) from the selected part (starting at (0, 0)).
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If some I/O error occured.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the given bounding values do not match with the bounds of the image sheet.
        See Also:
        loadImage(FileTree, String, String, int, int)

      • loadImage

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage[][] loadImage​(FileTree fileTree,
                                                         java.lang.String path,
                                                         int startX,
                                                         int startY,
                                                         int endX,
                                                         int endY,
                                                         int width,
                                                         int height)
                                                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                         java.io.IOException
        Loads an image from the given source and convert it into an image sheet. The images are created from (startX, startY) (inclusive) till (endX, endY) (exclusive).
        Each image in this sheet has size (width, height).
        Parameters:
        fileTree - The file tree to use.
        path - The path of the file inside the file tree.
        startX - The pixel x-coordinate of the start location in the image (incl.).
        startY - The pixel y-coordinate of the start location in the image (incl.).
        endX - The pixel x-coordinate of the end location of the image (excl.).
        endY - The pixel y-coordinate of the end location of the image (excl.).
        width - The width of each sub-image.
        height - The height of each sub-image.
        Returns:
        A 2D BufferedImage array, with the images loaded such that bi[x][y] represents the image part at (x, y) from the selected part (starting at (0, 0)).
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If some I/O error occured.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the given bounding values do not match with the bounds of the image sheet.
        See Also:
        loadImage(FileTree, String, String, int, int, int, int, int, int)

      • loadImage

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage[][] loadImage​(FileTree fileTree,
                                                         java.lang.String path,
                                                         java.lang.String idName)
                                                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                         java.io.IOException
        Loads an image from the given source and convert it into an image sheet.
        Parameters:
        fileTree - The file tree to use.
        path - The path of the file inside the file tree.
        idName - The ID of the image sheet to be created.
        Returns:
        A 2D BufferedImage array, with the images loaded such that bi[x][y] represents the image part at (x, y) from the selected part (starting at (0, 0)).
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If some I/O error occured.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the given bounding values do not match with the bounds of the image sheet.
        See Also:
        loadImage(FileTree, String, String, int, int)

      • loadImage

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage[][] loadImage​(FileTree fileTree,
                                                         java.lang.String path,
                                                         java.lang.String idName,
                                                         int startX,
                                                         int startY,
                                                         int endX,
                                                         int endY,
                                                         int width,
                                                         int height)
                                                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                         java.io.IOException
        Loads an image from the given source and convert it into an image sheet. The images are created from (startX, startY) (inclusive) till (endX, endY) (exclusive).
        Each image in this sheet has size (width, height).
        Parameters:
        fileTree - The file tree to use.
        path - The path of the file inside the file tree.
        idName - The ID of the image sheet to be created.
        startX - The pixel x-coordinate of the start location in the image (incl.).
        startY - The pixel y-coordinate of the start location in the image (incl.).
        endX - The pixel x-coordinate of the end location of the image (excl.).
        endY - The pixel y-coordinate of the end location of the image (excl.).
        width - The width of each sub-image.
        height - The height of each sub-image.
        Returns:
        A 2D BufferedImage array, with the images loaded such that bi[x][y] represents the image part at (x, y) from the selected part (starting at (0, 0)).
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If some I/O error occured.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the given bounding values do not match with the bounds of the image sheet.

      • loadImage

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage[][] loadImage​(FileTree fileTree,
                                                         java.lang.String path,
                                                         java.awt.Rectangle[][] locs)
                                                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                         java.io.IOException
        Loads an image from the given source and convert it into an image sheet.
        Parameters:
        fileTree - The file tree to use.
        path - The path of the file inside the file tree.
        locs - The locations and sizes of the images to load. The image stored at the indices of the returned image 2D array match the corresponding indices of this array.
        Returns:
        a 2D BufferedImage array, with the images loaded such that they match the indices of locs.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If some I/O error occured.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the given bounding values do not match with the bounds of the image sheet.
        See Also:
        loadImage(FileTree, String, String, Rectangle[][])

      • loadImage

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage[][] loadImage​(FileTree fileTree,
                                                         java.lang.String path,
                                                         java.lang.String idName,
                                                         java.awt.Rectangle[][] locs)
                                                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                         java.io.IOException
        Loads an image from the given source and convert it into an image sheet.
        Parameters:
        fileTree - The file tree to use.
        path - The path of the file inside the file tree.
        idName - The ID of the image sheet to be created.
        locs - The locations and sizes of the images to load. The image stored at the indices of the returned image 2D array match the corresponding indices of this array.
        Returns:
        a 2D BufferedImage array, with the images loaded such that they match the indices of locs.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If some I/O error occured.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the given bounding values do not match with the bounds of the image sheet.

      • ensureLoadedAndGetImage

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage[][] ensureLoadedAndGetImage​(FileTree fileTree,
                                                                       java.lang.String path)
                                                                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                                       java.io.IOException
        Check if the image sheet with the given ID already exists. If it doesn't, then create it with the given settings.
        Parameters:
        fileTree - The file tree to use.
        path - The path of the file inside the file tree.
        Returns:
        If the sheet was already loaded, then the loaded sheet. Otherwise attempt to load the sheet and return it.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If some I/O error occured.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the given bounding values do not match with the bounds of the image sheet.
        See Also:
        ensureLoadedAndGetImage(FileTree, String, String)

      • ensureLoadedAndGetImage

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage[][] ensureLoadedAndGetImage​(FileTree fileTree,
                                                                       java.lang.String path,
                                                                       int width,
                                                                       int height)
                                                                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                                       java.io.IOException
        Check if the image sheet with the given ID already exists. If it doesn't, then create it with the given settings.
        Parameters:
        fileTree - The file tree to use.
        path - The path of the file inside the file tree.
        width - The width of each sub-image.
        height - The height of each sub-image.
        Returns:
        If the sheet was already loaded, then the loaded sheet. Otherwise attempt to load the sheet and return it.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If some I/O error occured.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the given bounding values do not match with the bounds of the image sheet.
        See Also:
        ensureLoadedAndGetImage(FileTree, String, String, int, int, int, int, int, int)

      • ensureLoadedAndGetImage

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage[][] ensureLoadedAndGetImage​(FileTree fileTree,
                                                                       java.lang.String path,
                                                                       int startX,
                                                                       int startY,
                                                                       int endX,
                                                                       int endY,
                                                                       int width,
                                                                       int height)
                                                                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                                       java.io.IOException
        Check if the image sheet with the given ID already exists. If it doesn't, then create it with the given settings.
        Parameters:
        fileTree - The file tree to use.
        path - The path of the file inside the file tree.
        startX - The pixel x-coordinate of the start location in the image (incl.).
        startY - The pixel y-coordinate of the start location in the image (incl.).
        endX - The pixel x-coordinate of the end location of the image (excl.).
        endY - The pixel y-coordinate of the end location of the image (excl.).
        width - The width of each sub-image.
        height - The height of each sub-image.
        Returns:
        If the sheet was already loaded, then the loaded sheet. Otherwise attempt to load the sheet and return it.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If some I/O error occured.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the given bounding values do not match with the bounds of the image sheet.
        See Also:
        ensureLoadedAndGetImage(FileTree, String, String, int, int, int, int, int, int)

      • ensureLoadedAndGetImage

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage[][] ensureLoadedAndGetImage​(FileTree fileTree,
                                                                       java.lang.String path,
                                                                       java.lang.String idName)
                                                                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                                       java.io.IOException
        Check if the image sheet with the given ID already exists. If it doesn't, then create it with the given settings.
        Parameters:
        fileTree - The file tree to use.
        path - The path of the file inside the file tree.
        idName - The ID of the image sheet to be retrieved and, if needed, created.
        Returns:
        If the sheet was already loaded, then the loaded sheet. Otherwise attempt to load the sheet and return it.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If some I/O error occured.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the given bounding values do not match with the bounds of the image sheet.
        See Also:
        ensureLoadedAndGetImage(FileTree, String, String, int, int)

      • ensureLoadedAndGetImage

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage[][] ensureLoadedAndGetImage​(FileTree fileTree,
                                                                       java.lang.String path,
                                                                       java.lang.String idName,
                                                                       int startX,
                                                                       int startY,
                                                                       int endX,
                                                                       int endY,
                                                                       int width,
                                                                       int height)
                                                                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                                       java.io.IOException
        Check if the image sheet with the given ID already exists. If it doesn't, then create it with the given settings.
        Parameters:
        fileTree - The file tree to use.
        path - The path of the file inside the file tree.
        idName - The ID of the image sheet to be retrieved and, if needed, created.
        startX - The pixel x-coordinate of the start location in the image (incl.).
        startY - The pixel y-coordinate of the start location in the image (incl.).
        endX - The pixel x-coordinate of the end location of the image (excl.).
        endY - The pixel y-coordinate of the end location of the image (excl.).
        width - The width of each sub-image.
        height - The height of each sub-image.
        Returns:
        If the sheet was already loaded, then the loaded sheet. Otherwise attempt to load the sheet and return it.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If some I/O error occured.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the given bounding values do not match with the bounds of the image sheet.
        See Also:
        loadImage(FileTree, String, String, int, int, int, int, int, int)

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage[][] ensureLoadedAndGetImage​(FileTree fileTree,
                                                                       java.lang.String path,
                                                                       java.awt.Rectangle[][] locs)
                                                                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                                       java.io.IOException
        Check if the image sheet with the given ID already exists. If it doesn't, then create it with the given settings.
        Parameters:
        fileTree - The file tree to use.
        path - The path of the file inside the file tree.
        locs - The locations and sizes of the images to load. The image stored at the indices of the returned image 2D array match the corresponding indices of this array.
        Returns:
        If the sheet was already loaded, then the loaded sheet. Otherwise attempt to load the sheet and return it.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If some I/O error occured.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the given bounding values do not match with the bounds of the image sheet.
        See Also:

      • ensureLoadedAndGetImage

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage[][] ensureLoadedAndGetImage​(FileTree fileTree,
                                                                       java.lang.String path,
                                                                       java.lang.String idName,
                                                                       java.awt.Rectangle[][] locs)
                                                                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                                       java.io.IOException
        Check if the image sheet with the given ID already exists. If it doesn't, then create it with the given settings.
        Parameters:
        fileTree - The file tree to use.
        path - The path of the file inside the file tree.
        idName - The ID of the image sheet to be retrieved and, if needed, created.
        locs - The locations and sizes of the images to load. The image stored at the indices of the returned image 2D array match the corresponding indices of this array.
        Returns:
        If the sheet was already loaded, then the loaded sheet. Otherwise attempt to load the sheet and return it.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If some I/O error occured.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the given bounding values do not match with the bounds of the image sheet.
        See Also:
        loadImage(FileTree, String, Rectangle[][])

      • getImage

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage[][] getImage​(java.lang.String idName)
        Returns an earlier stored image array.
        Parameters:
        idName - The ID of the image sheet to be retrieved.
        Returns:
        The image sheet with the given ID, or null if no such sheet exists.

      • getImageException

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage[][] getImageException​(java.lang.String idName)
                                                          throws java.lang.NoSuchFieldException
        Returns an earlier stored image.
        Parameters:
        idName - The ID of the image sheet to be retrieved.
        Returns:
        The image sheet with the given ID.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NoSuchFieldException - If there doesn't exists an image sheet with the given ID.

      • removeImage

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage[][] removeImage​(java.lang.String idName)
        Removes a stored image sheet.
        Parameters:
        idName - The ID of the image sheet to be removed.
        Returns:
        The removed image sheet, or null if there was no image sheet with the given ID.

      • clear

        public static void clear()
        Removes all stored image sheets.

      • iterator

        public static java.util.Iterator<java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.String,​java.awt.image.BufferedImage[][]>> iterator()
        Returns:
        An iterator over all currently stored image sheets.
